newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia late rubber flat after U.S. sale news.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia late rubber flat after U.S. sale news.

text.p: Indonesian benchmark SIR20 offer prices were flat in late trading on Wednesday as the market gave a mixed reaction to reports of a planned sale of the United States natural rubber surplus, dealers said.

Dealers said SIR20 offer prices for September/October deliveries remained at 55.00-55.25 U.S. cents/lb fob Medan, 54.50-55.00 cents fob Palembang, Surabaya as well as Padang, and at 53.75-54.24 cents fob Jambi and Pontianak.
Some dealers in Padang and Medan said the reports were likely to impact negatively on Indonesian rubber, but some Jakarta-based dealers said they were unlikely to have any impact.
U.S. Defense National Stockpile Center planned to start selling up to 60,000 tonnes of surplus natural rubber, both ribbed smoked sheets and technically specified blocks early next year.
It is definitely not a good news for rubber traders in Padang. Unlike in Medan and Palembang, dealers in Padang export almost all of their rubber to the United States, one Padang dealer said.
"We are still waiting for the details, but it is likely to be business as usual. The market has become accustomed to such reports," one Jakarta-based dealer said.
Dealers said SIR20 was last traded late on Tuesday at 55.00 cents/lb fob Medan October deliveries.
Dealers said high amoniac grade latex was on offer at 2,325-2,350 rupiah/kg in Bandung and Tangerang against the previous 2,425 rupiah/kg.
